questions.question: In WDG Automation Studio, several commands for handling files have the parameter “File System”, which must be filled in for the correct handling of files. If the parameter is not entered, the script will run normally. basis is best encapsulated by which of the following cloud business enablers?

In the WDG Automation Language (WAL), variables are a symbolic reference to the memory position that stores data at runtime. This data can be obtained by referencing the variable name using the syntax: ${<variable_name>}.

Which the command has as one of its functions to print an output message?
Select one:

By clicking on the left side of the command line in the Designer interface, it is defined:
Select one:

In the WDG Automation Studio tool, the construction of the script done by drag-and-drop functionality is done in which interface?
Select one:

Check the correct alternative. 
I. Routines are not executed at runtime. 
II. Routine is a piece of code that can be called repeatedly by the main script. 
III. There are two ways to create a new routine: the first is using the “New Routine” button in the “Home” menu;  the other is by right-clicking on a command, and going to “Advanced” > “Extract Routine” 
IV. We can visualize the flow of the routines created by going to the Call Graph interface.
Select one:
options: Only I and III are correct.
Only I and IV are correct.
Only I, II and III are correct.
Only II, III and IV are correct.
